HelloComponent.jsx ```js import React from 'react'; import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; export default class HelloComponent extends React.Component { render () { return (

Hello beauty!

); } } ``` 3. index.html ```html
``` 4. main.js ```js import React from 'react'; import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; import Hello from './HelloComponent.jsx'; ReactDOM.render(, document.getElementById('app')); ``` ## ``` npm install (package.json) webpack ``` `index.html` ## webpackloader[create-react-app][4]reactjswebpack ----------------------------2017.02.27----------------------------------- webpack2.x[react][5] ## [webpack][1]webpack

# ![image](/assets/images/2016/wang-bao-qiang1.png)
# - - - > ReactNativefacebookgithub900issueRN > ReactNativeRNstatestate > debugstate > ReduxReduxRN > NoticeRNreactjs > [demo][6] # Redux - - - Reduxjavascript[Flux](http://facebook.github.io/flux/)Flux ReduxActionReducerStorage ``` import { createStore } from 'redux' /* * * actionaction * * **type**reducertypestate * */ let action = { type: INCREMENT, params: xxxx, }; /** * This is a reducer, a pure function with (state, action) => state signature. * It describes how an action transforms the state into the next state. * * The shape of the state is up to you: it can be a primitive, an array, an object, * or even an Immutable.js data structure. The only important part is that you should * not mutate the state object, but return a new object if the state changes. * * In this example, we use a `switch` statement and strings, but you can use a helper that * follows a different convention (such as function maps) if it makes sense for your * project. */ /* * * reducerstate * * statestate * reduxstatestate * */ function reducer(state = 0, action) { switch (action.type) { case 'INCREMENT': return state + 1 case 'DECREMENT': return state - 1 default: return state } } // Create a Redux store holding the state of your app. // Its API is { subscribe, dispatch, getState }. /* * storestate * createStore(reducer) reducerreducerstorestorestate * reducerstoregoogle** ** */ let store = createStore(reducer) // You can use subscribe() to update the UI in response to state changes. // Normally you'd use a view binding library (e.g. React Redux) rather than subscribe() directly. // However it can also be handy to persist the current state in the localStorage. /* * * state * statelocalStoragestatelocalStorage * */ store.subscribe(() => console.log(store.getState()) ) // The only way to mutate the internal state is to dispatch an action. // The actions can be serialized, logged or stored and later replayed. /* * * dispatch: actionstoreactionreducercreateStoragestore * */ store.dispatch({ type: 'INCREMENT' }) // 1 store.dispatch({ type: 'INCREMENT' }) // 2 store.dispatch({ type: 'DECREMENT' }) // 1 ``` ****action->store->storereducer(state)->UIRNstaterender

****storestatereducerstatestatereducerstate2state1state1state1. ![image](/assets/images/2016/react-native-redux-scornful1.jpg)
![image](/assets/images/2016/react-native-redux-maoli.jpeg)
demo > > People often ask me what advice I'd give someone who wants to start their own company. > My answer is that every good company that I can think of started with someone caring about changing something, not someone deciding > to start a company. Instead of trying to build a company, focus on the change you want to see in the world and just keep pushing > forward. > # Redux Thunk [github][4]
**thunk** thunkexpressionexpression ``` // 1+2 // calculation of 1 + 2 is immediate // x === 3 let x = 1 + 2; // 1+2foo // calculation of 1 + 2 is delayed // foo can be called later to perform the calculation // foo is a thunk! let foo = () => 1 + 2; ``` *readme***Motivation**

**Redux Thunk middleware**action creatorfunctionaction
Thunk dispatchactiondispatch
inner functionstoredispatchgetState
``` // action creator functiondispatch const INCREMENT_COUNTER = 'INCREMENT_COUNTER'; function increment() { return { type: INCREMENT_COUNTER }; } function incrementAsync() { return dispatch => { setTimeout(() => { // Yay! Can invoke sync or async actions with `dispatch` dispatch(increment()); }, 1000); }; } ``` ``` // action creatorfunctiondispatch function incrementIfOdd() { return (dispatch, getState) => { const { counter } = getState(); if (counter % 2 === 0) { return; } dispatch(increment()); }; } ``` # Demo->Discolor [star](https://github.com/CoderLim/react-native-redux-example/tree/master/Discolor)
demoCounters
downdemo

``` import * as types from './actionTypes'; export function change2red() { return { type: types.CHANGE2RED, } } export function change2green() { return { type: types.CHANGE2GREEN, } } ``` **components/discolor.js**RN ``` import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { StyleSheet, View, Text, TouchableHighlight, } from 'react-native'; export default class Discolor extends Component { constructor(props) { super (props); } render() { // DiscolorApp const { color, change2red, change2green} = this.props; return ( change2red change2green ); } } const styles = StyleSheet.create({ container: { flex: 1, justifyContent: 'center', alignItems: 'center', backgroundColor: 'purple', }, button: { width: 120, height: 40, backgroundColor: 'lightgray', alignItems: 'center', justifyContent: 'center', margin: 3, }, }); ``` **containers/discolorApp.js** ``` 'use strict' // javascript import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { bindActionCreators } from 'redux'; import Discolor from '../components/discolor'; import * as discolorActions from '../actions/discolorActions'; import { connect } from 'react-redux'; class DiscolorApp extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props); } render() { const { state, actions } = this.props; return ( ); } } /* * * connect([mapStateToProps], [mapDispatchToProps], [mergeProps], [options]) * * http://cn.redux.js.org/docs/react-redux/api.html * * [mapStateToProps(state, [ownProps]): stateProps] (Function): Redux store * Redux store mapStateToProps * props Redux store * ownProps props propsmapStateToProps * * state: state.discolordiscolorreducers/discolor.js * Redux storediscolordiscolorstate * discolorstatereducer */ export default connect(state => ({ state: state.discolor }), (dispatch) => ({ /* * bindActionCreators : action creators keys dispatch action creator * bindActionCreators * { * change2red: dispatch(discolorActions.change2red), * change2green: dispatch(discolorActions.change2green), * } */ actions: bindActionCreators(discolorActions, dispatch), }) )(DiscolorApp); ``` **containers/app.js** ``` import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { createStore, applyMiddleware, combineReducers } from 'redux'; import { Provider } from 'react-redux'; import thunk from 'redux-thunk'; import * as reducers from '../reducers'; import DiscolorApp from './discolorApp'; /* * * applyMiddlewarethunk * */ const createStoreWithMiddleware = applyMiddleware(thunk)(createStore); /* * * reducer * */ const reducer = combineReducers(reducers); const store = createStoreWithMiddleware(reducer); export default class App extends Component { render() { return ( ); } } ``` **reducers/discolor.js** ``` /* * * reducer * */ import * as types from '../actions/actionTypes'; const initialState = { color: 'red', }; export default function discolor(state = initialState, action = {}) { switch (action.type) { case types.CHANGE2RED: return { ...state, color: 'red', }; case types.CHANGE2GREEN: return { ...state, color: 'green', }; default: return state; } } ``` **reducers/index.js**reducerdiscolor

Post.title: webpack
Post._content:
## gulp[Gulp for Beginners](https://css-tricks.com/gulp-for-beginners/)
* **webpack**; * **webpack**; * **loaders**; * ****; ## webpack [node.js](https://nodejs.org/). ``` $ npm install webpack -g ``` > webpack ## (Compilation) .
:
**add entry.js** ``` document.write("It works"); ``` **add index.html** ``` ``` : ``` $ webpack ./entry.js bundle.js ``` **bundle**.
: ``` Version: webpack 1.12.11 Time: 51ms Asset Size Chunks Chunk Names bundle.js 1.42 kB 0 [emitted] main chunk {0} bundle.js (main) 28 bytes [rendered] [0] ./tutorials/getting-started/setup-compilation/entry.js 28 bytes {0} [built] ``` index.html`It works`. ## **content.js**: ``` module.exports = "It works from content.js."; ``` **entry.js** ``` document.write(require("./content.js")); ``` : ``` $ webpack ./entry.js bundle.js ``` index.html,`It works from content.js.` > webpack**entry** > bundle.jswebpacki > idbundle.jsid. > entry**require** > ## loader css webpackjavascript`css-loader`CSS `style-loader`CSS `npm install css-loader style-loader`loaders`-g` `node_module`loaders **style.css**: ``` body { background: yellow; } ``` **entry.js**: ``` require("!style!css!./style.css"); document.write(require("./content.js")); ``` > loaderloaderloader. > javascript ## loader require `require("!style!css!./style.css");`. loader`require("./style.css")` **entry.js** ``` require("./style.css"); document.write(require("./content.js")); ``` ``` webpack ./entry.js bundle.js --module-bind 'css=style!css' ``` > module-bind css=style!css ## **webpack.config.js** ``` module.exports = { entry: "./entry.js", output: { path: __dirname, filename: "bundle.js" }, module: { loaders: [ { test: /\.css$/, loader: "style!css" } ] } }; ``` `webpack` ``` Version: webpack 1.12.11 Time: 379ms Asset Size Chunks Chunk Names bundle.js 10.7 kB 0 [emitted] main chunk {0} bundle.js (main) 8.86 kB [rendered] [0] ./tutorials/getting-started/config-file/entry.js 65 bytes {0} [built] [1] ./tutorials/getting-started/config-file/style.css 943 bytes {0} [built] [2] ../~/css-loader!./tutorials/getting-started/config-file/style.css 201 bytes {0} [built] [3] ../~/css-loader/lib/css-base.js 1.51 kB {0} [built] [4] ../~/style-loader/addStyles.js 6.09 kB {0} [built] [5] ./tutorials/getting-started/config-file/content.js 45 bytes {0} [built] ``` > webpack**webpack.config.js** ## ... ``` webpack --progress --colors ``` ## watch ``` webpack --progress --colors --watch ``` webpack > watchwebpackwatcherwebpack > ## development server development server ``` npm install webpack-dev-server -g ``` ``` webpack-dev-server --progress --colors ``` localhost:8080expressbundle bundle(SockJS)[http://localhost:8080/webpack-dev-server/bundle]() > dev serverwebpackwatchwebpack ## [webpack-getting-started](https://webpack.github.io/docs/tutorials/getting-started/) [WebpackTutorial](https://github.com/AriaFallah/WebpackTutorial/tree/master/part1)
